text: Top prosecutors in D.C., Minneapolis leave amid turmoil over shooting probe - The Washington Post

text: Pace of Inflation Held Steady in December; Consumer Prices Up 2.7% on Year - The Wall Street Journal

text: Adelaide Writers Week canceled as 180 speakers withdraw after the exclusion of a Palestinian writer - AP News

text: Fact check: Trump litters Detroit economic speech with numerous false claims about economy - CNN
fullText: Inflation hasn’t “stopped.” Consumer prices are up during this presidential term, not “down.” Grocery prices are rising, not starting to fall “rapidly.” US businesses and consumers, not China, pay US tariffs on Chinese imports. It’s impossible to reduce presc…

text: US oil producers pledge to help stabilize Iran if regime falls - Politico
fullText: American Petroleum Institute President Mike Sommers indicated the industry is more open to helping in Iran than it has been with Venezuela.

text: Matt LaFleur is left “speechless” by Aaron Rodgers’s comments - NBC Sports

text: Access to Elon Musk’s Starlink internet service is now free in Iran as regime continues brutal crackdown on protests - CNN
fullText: Elon Musk’s SpaceX is now providing free internet access via its Starlink satellite service to users in Iran as the country’s regime continues its bloody crackdown on anti-government protests, according to a tech expert in touch with Iranian Starlink users.

text: Sources: Mets offer Tucker in $50M AAV ballpark - ESPN
fullText: Free agent outfielder Kyle Tucker has been offered a short-term deal by the Mets that is believed to be worth $50 million per season, sources told ESPN.

text: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms review: The new Game of Thrones prequel is 'very funny' and a 'total delight' - BBC
fullText: The latest spin-off from Game of Thrones tells the story of an inexperienced knight and his cheeky squire. With its mix of brutal drama and plentiful humour, it's a "nailed-on winner".

text: 'Super flu' confirmed in Calif. as hospitalizations hit season high - SFGATE

text: Linda Brown, Chicago teacher found dead in Lake Michigan at 31st Street Harbor, died by suicide, drowning: medical examiner - ABC7 Chicago

text: FTC accuses AI search engine of 'rampant consumer deception' - NPR
fullText: Federal officials say a company that operates hundreds of landing pages for AI answers is running an operation that has duped thousands of users, who were unable to stop costly monthly charges.
